title: Ticket #835: Make ExprTree handling in old ClassAds more like new ClassAds
description:
One of the difficulties in writing a compatibility layer over new ClassAds is that ExprTrees are handled differently between old and new ClassAds. In old ClassAds, for each attribute in an ad, the assignment operator and attribute name are included in the ExprTree. When a user retrieves an attribute's ExprTree, that full tree is returned, including assignment operator and attribute name. In new ClassAds, ExprTree has no assignment operator. The tree contains only the value of each attribute, and the name is stored separately as a string.

We can ease the transition from old to new ClassAds by having users of old ClassAds handle ExprTrees like with new ClassAds. While the internal handling of ExprTrees will remain the same, the API can be changed to only expose the attribute value portion of the ExprTree and provide the attribute name as a separate string.

By also adding a free-standing function for unparsing an ExprTree into a string, we can eliminate most calls on ExprTree methods that don't have a transparent equivalent in new ClassAds.
remarks:
2009-Oct-12 12:00:06 by jfrey:
We'll need new versions of the following functions:
  • int AttrList::Insert( ExprTree* )
  • ExprTree *AttrList::NextExpr()
  • ExprTree *AttrList::NextDirtyExpr()
  • int Parse( const char*, ExprTree*&, int *)
  • ExprTree *AttrList::Lookup( const char* )

2009-Oct-12 15:08:16 by jfrey:
Pushed changes to V7_3-new_classads-branch to add and use the following new functions for old ClassAds:
  • int AttrList::ClassAd::Insert( const char*, ExprTree* )
  • ExprTree* AttrList::NextExpr( const char*&, ExprTree*& )
  • ExprTree* AttrList::NextDirtyExpr( const char*&, ExprTree*& )
  • ExprTree* AttrList::LookupExpr( const char* )
  • int Parse( const char*, MyString&, ExprTree*&, int* )

2009-Oct-13 02:14:35 by jfrey:
Pushed changes to V7_3-new_classads-branch that remove calls to the old AttrList methods and make the methods private.

2009-Oct-13 10:13:20 by jfrey:
Pushed changes to V7_3-new_classads-branch to make the old Parse() function private to the old ClassAds library.
